text: Daydreamer is a video game developed by Roland Studios. ==Plot== In a distant future where the world has been taken over by aliens and undergoing a civil war, a young girl called Olivia must rescue her brother from the aliens.http://www.igf.com/php-bin/entry2015.php?id=7552 ==Gameplay== Weapons at the players disposal will include laser guns and flamethrowers. The player will have pets to assist them in tasks. The player will encounter large bosses.http://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2015/03/06/the-very- best-indie-games-of-gdc-2015.aspx The game is a side scroller.http://nichegamer.com/2015/02/everything-and-the-kitchen-sink- monster-is-in-side-scrolling-shmup-daydreamer/ ==Development== Daydreamer was showcased at the Moscone Center’s GDC Play Area at the 2015 Game Developer Conference. It is set for release in summer 2015. It had an unsuccessful crowdfunding campaign.https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1219798749/daydreamer-1http://www.ibtimes.co.in/gdc-2015-recap-6-best- indie-games-you-should- know-625700http://meetings.gdconf.com/index.php?page=cat_par¶ms;%5Bid%5D=217 Daydreamer has Sprite graphics, of rather high quality for its characters, contrasted by a lot of scrolling check patterns for its pause menu. It also features an interface designed for a gamepad, to the point where the game only displays Gamepad inputs for menues and tutorial messages even when played only a keyboard on Windows. The game is planned to launch on PlayStation 4 on July 12. An Xbox One version of the game was originally planned but was cancelled.https://twitter.com/JohnLHardin/status/751543606981238784 ==Reception== Daydreamer received a score of 68/100 on Metacritic for the PlayStation 4 version of the game, indicating "mixed or average" reviews. Hardcore Gamer gave the PlayStation 4 version of the game a 3.5/5, praising the art style and how it pays homage to platform games from the 1990s. ==References== Category:2015 video games Category:Cancelled Xbox One games Category:Indie video games Category:PlayStation 4 games Category:Science fiction video games Category:Side-scrolling video games Category:Video games developed in the United States Category:Video games featuring female protagonists Category:Windows games
